title: Define Project Scope and Requirements
description:
Gather and document the project requirements, define the scope, and identify the target users and use cases for the SecureCodeAnalyzer tool. Ensure to cover the following aspects:

- Supported programming languages and frameworks (Python, JavaScript, Java, C++, etc.) with an emphasis on popular frameworks like React, Angular, Django, Express, Spring Boot, etc.
- Integration with common IDEs and code editors (Visual Studio Code, IntelliJ IDEA, PyCharm, Atom, etc.) and support for plugin development for others, including VS Code marketplace publishing
- Real-time code analysis capabilities with options to pause/resume analysis as needed, and the ability to analyze entire projects or specific files
- Vulnerability detection techniques (static analysis, dynamic analysis, taint analysis, etc.), including support for identifying security issues in third-party libraries and dependencies, and offering integration with tools like Black Duck
- Secure coding best practices and recommendations based on OWASP Top Ten and SANS 25 Most Dangerous Software Errors, as well as industry-specific guidelines when applicable
- Reporting and alerting mechanisms (email, Slack, API, etc.) with configurable severity levels, customizable notification preferences, and the ability to export reports in various formats (CSV, PDF, etc.)
- User interface and experience requirements (intuitive design, clear feedback, customizable settings) focusing on usability for both developers and security teams, including accessibility according to the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG 2.1)
- Performance and scalability requirements (handling large codebases, low latency, efficient memory usage), including performance benchmarks and scalability testing plans with a focus on high concurrency scenarios
- Deployment and maintenance considerations (cloud deployment options, version control, updates, security patches), with support for continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) workflows, containerization, and microservices architecture
- Accessibility requirements according to the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG 2.1) for web applications and user interfaces, as well as ensuring compatibility with assistive technologies such as screen readers
- Documentation requirements (technical documentation, user guides, tutorials, and API documentation), including a public REST API and SDKs for popular languages
- Testing and quality assurance (QA) considerations with a focus on code coverage, functional testing, security testing, and performance testing
* Consider adding a section for threat modeling, vulnerability management, and penetration testing to identify potential threats and weaknesses in the system

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture, including the components, data flow, and integration points for the SecureCodeAnalyzer tool.

title: Develop Code Analysis Engine
description: Implement the core code analysis engine that can parse and analyze code in real-time for security vulnerabilities and coding best practices.

title: Implement User Interface
description: Design and develop the user interface for the SecureCodeAnalyzer tool, including code editors, analysis results display, and suggested remediation steps.

title: Set up Data Storage and Management
description: Design and implement the data storage and management system for storing and retrieving code analysis results, user preferences, and other relevant data.

title: Implement Security Vulnerability Detection Rules
description: Research and implement a comprehensive set of rules and patterns for detecting security vulnerabilities in various programming languages and frameworks.

title: Develop Secure Coding Best Practices Library
description: Curate and maintain a library of secure coding best practices, guidelines, and remediation steps for various programming languages and frameworks.

title: Integrate with CI/CD Pipelines
description: Develop integrations and plugins for popular CI/CD tools to enable seamless integration of the SecureCodeAnalyzer tool into existing development workflows.

title: Implement Reporting and Audit Trail
description: Develop reporting and audit trail capabilities to track code analysis results, remediation actions, and overall project security posture.
dependencies: Set up Data Storage and Management

title: Conduct Comprehensive Testing
description: Plan and execute a comprehensive testing strategy, including unit tests, integration tests, performance tests, and user acceptance testing, to ensure the quality and reliability of the SecureCodeAnalyzer tool.
dependencies: Develop Secure Coding Best Practices Library

title: Deploy and Monitor
description: Plan and execute the deployment strategy for the SecureCodeAnalyzer tool, including monitoring, logging, and incident response procedures.

title: Develop Documentation and Training Materials
description: Create comprehensive documentation, user guides, and training materials to support the adoption and effective use of the SecureCodeAnalyzer tool.
dependencies: Develop Secure Coding Best Practices Library
